result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Cindy A Knotek
Current: 3404 17th ST, Racine, WI 53405 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2022)
Prior: 1647 Taylor Ave, Racine, WI 53403
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim J.A.(person, property, residence or family).

1:33 PM Defendant Cindy A Knotek appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Cindy A Knotek.  Prosecuting attorney Azucena C Guizar Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
